faq_section.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq_section.subtitle: We answer the most common questions about our services

faqs.question: How long does it take to develop a project?
faqs.answer: Timelines vary depending on the project's complexity. A landing page can be ready in 2â€“3 weeks, while a complete application may take 8â€“12 weeks. We always provide a detailed schedule before starting.

faqs.question: What does post-launch support include?
faqs.answer: Our support includes bug fixes, security updates, data backups, basic monitoring, and technical assistance. The support period varies based on the package (1â€“6 months included).

faqs.question: Can I make changes during development?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! We work with an agile methodology that allows adjustments throughout the process. Minor changes are included, while major modifications are assessed on a case-by-case basis.

faqs.question: Do you offer a warranty on your work?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer a 30-day warranty against malfunctions after launch. In addition, all our projects include a free technical support period.

faqs.question: How do you handle intellectual property?
faqs.answer: Once payment is completed, all intellectual property of the project (code, designs, content) is 100% yours. We deliver all source files and full documentation.

faqs.question: Do you work with companies from other countries?
faqs.answer: Yes, we work with clients worldwide. We have experience in international projects and adapt to different time zones to facilitate communication.

faqs.question: What technologies do you use?
faqs.answer: We use modern and proven technologies such as React, Next.js, Node.js, Python, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, among others. We choose the best technology based on each projectâ€™s specific needs.

faqs.question: Can I see examples of past work?
faqs.answer: Of course. We have a portfolio with detailed case studies of projects like helloflatmate, viaje seguro, and clean net. We can show you similar examples during the initial consultation.
